intro: Phagnalon embergeri, commonly known as the Emberger's phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its drought tolerance and unique morphology, it is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
